pullrequest.title: Permit trigger slope to be specified for wait timeouts

content.raw: Actually no - this trigger is for the output of the waitmonitor that is fed back to its input, not the one going to pseudoclock to resume it after a timeout. So they're distinct. Deleting  `trigger_edge_type='rising',` seems unrelated to this pull request, and has no effect since that is the default value of that argument for a `Trigger` in any case.
content.html: Actually no - this trigger is for the output of the waitmonitor that is fed back to its input, not the one going to pseudoclock to resume it after a timeout. So they're distinct. Deleting trigger_edge_type='rising', seems unrelated to this pull request, and has no effect since that is the default value of that argument for a Trigger in any case.
